description:
The Outpatient Diagnostic Program determines if an individual suffers any memory loss and if so, what type. Neurology, psychiatry, social work, neuropsychology testing, lab work, EEG, MRI/CT scan may be needed to arrive at a complete diagnosis.

Service - social workers provides counseling, support groups, guidance regarding financial and advance directives, and referrals to various community programs and agencies.

Education/Training - RN, SW, and MD's provide education and training in the community to inform people about memory loss and dementia.

Ongoing research programs include investigational drug studies and free memory screening program.
name: WIEN CENTER FOR ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE AND MEMORY DISORDERS
